text: Nocardia is a genus of bacteria with more than 100 species. It is found worldwide in organic-matter-rich soil. Some species cause harm if eaten. == Culture == Nocardia uses aerobic respiration to grow in a wide temperature range. == Virulence == Most Nocardia strains have a virulence factor which damages hosts. Transmission of bacteria via inhalation or through open wounds may lead to Nocardia infection. People with weakened immune systems are more susceptible to Nocardia infections. == Treatment == Nocardia infections are treated by sulfonamide antibiotics. Antibiotic therapy and proper wound care are essential to patient recovery. == References == Category:Gram-positive bacteria
title: Nocardia
